By James Bithell

Telegrams from Switzerland

Many Anglophones remain immune to both the need and the inclination to learn a foreign language.

Telegrams from Switzerland

Learning behind bars

"We have one very serious rule in here," I am warned as I settle myself down. "We don't talk about what people are in for. Whatever they've done..." What is it like trying to study in a jail cell? <strong>Nicky Woolf</strong> talks to people on both sides of the bars to uncover the gritty realities of learning in a prison classroom.

Mr Brown's secret island

Tourist destination or tax haven, insular community or island retreat, <strong>Henry James Foy</strong> talks to the man in charge to discover what the Isle of Man is really all about.

How to survive the credit crunch

You don't have to read the Financial Times to realise that the current financial climate does not look bright. House prices are falling, it is becoming more difficult to get a mortgage or a loan, and a couple of banks seem to have disappeared down the plughole. <strong>Will Heaven</strong> finds out how to stay afloat</em>

Four classic cocktails to see you through summer days and nights: Trailer Happiness Grog, Johnny Fransman's Pimm's cup, The perfect summer G&T, The Faithless, Mal Spence.
